}
 

NOTES late collision (data received before collision) late collisions cannot be detected by the receiver they would appear as JAM bits which would appear as bad FCS or carrier extend error which is CVMX_PIP_EXTEND_ERR.

Interface to the hardware Packet Input Processing unit.

NOTES late collision (data received before collision) late collisions cannot be detected by the receiver they would appear as JAM bits which would appear as bad FCS or carrier extend error which is CVMX_PIP_EXTEND_ERR.

static void cvmx_pip_set_bsel_pos ( int  bit,
int  pos,
int  val 
) [inline, static]

Initialize Bit Select Extractor config.

Their are 8 bit positions and valids to be used when using the corresponding extractor.

Parameters:
bit Bit Select Extractor to use
pos Which position to update
val The value to update the position with

uint32_t  max_size 
) [inline, static]

Set byte count for Max-Sized and Min Sized frame check.

Parameters:

max_size Byte count for Max-Size frame check
static void cvmx_pip_tag_mask_clear ( uint64_t  mask_index  )  [inline, static]

Clear all bits in a tag mask.

This should be called on startup before any calls to cvmx_pip_tag_mask_set. Each bit set in the final mask represent a byte used in the packet for tag generation.

Parameters:
mask_index Which tag mask to clear (0..3)
static void cvmx_pip_tag_mask_set ( uint64_t  mask_index,
uint64_t  offset,
uint64_t  len 
) [inline, static]

Sets a range of bits in the tag mask.

The tag mask is used when the cvmx_pip_port_tag_cfg_t tag_mode is non zero. There are four separate masks that can be configured.

Parameters:
mask_index Which tag mask to modify (0..3)
offset Offset into the bitmask to set bits at. Use the GCC macro offsetof() to determine the offsets into packet headers. For example, offsetof(ethhdr, protocol) returns the offset of the ethernet protocol field. The bitmask selects which bytes to include the the tag, with bit offset X selecting byte at offset X from the beginning of the packet data.
len Number of bytes to include. Usually this is the sizeof() the field.
